name: viably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is able to succeed or to work as intended: The challenge to me as a manufacturer is to run the company viably. It doesn't have enough bedrooms to run viably as a guest house.
biology
  specialized in a way that is able to continue to exist or develop into a living being: The brain of the foetusbegins to function long before it can exist viably outside the womb. If the process is interrupted, the egg cannot develop viably. See
viable
More examplesFewer examplesPrices dropped to a point where it became virtually impossible for the mine to operate viably.These devices cannot compete viably with the mobile phone.Cells may be viably frozen and thawed with relative ease.
